list.title: RequestAnimationFrameProcess#RequestAnimationFrameProcess
list.description: A process based on the requestAnimationFrame native browser method

list.title: RequestAnimationFrameProcess#fps
list.description: frame rate per second

list.title: RequestAnimationFrameProcess#start
list.description: Start process

list.title: RequestAnimationFrameProcess#stop
list.description: Will stop requesAnimationFrame at the next tick

list.title: RequestAnimationFrameProcess#stopped
list.description: false if the is still running

list.title: RequestService
list.description: Used by Widget.WebService Service used to make authentificate HTTP requests (with a token) Wiki : https://github.com/MEPP-team/UD-Viz/wiki/Request-Service#request-service

list.title: RequestService#request
list.description: Performs an HTTP request.

list.title: URLSetCameraMatrix
list.description: Initialize camera matrix with url search params produced by appendCameraMatrixToURL

list.title: Vector2Input
list.description: A custom element with two input fields for x and y values, and dispatches a 'change' event when any of the input values are changed.

list.title: Vector2Input#inputElements
list.description: The function returns an array of input elements.

list.title: Vector3Input
list.description: A custom element with three input fields for x, y and z values, and dispatches a 'change' event when any of the input values are changed.

list.title: Vector3Input#inputElements
list.description: The function returns an array of input elements.

list.title: Vector4Input
list.description: A custom element with four input fields for x, y, z and w values, and dispatches a 'change' event when any of the input values are changed.

list.title: Vector4Input#inputElements
list.description: The function returns an array of input elements.

list.title: addLights
list.description: Add default lights to a scene 3D one directional and one ambient

list.title: appendCameraMatrixToURL
list.description: Append in search params of an url the camera matrix

list.title: appendWireframeByGeometryAttributeToObject3D
list.description: Traverse a THREE.Object3D and append in each Object3D children a THREE.LineSegment geometry representing its wireframe. Each wireframe geometry will keep the associated attribute value.

list.title: appendWireframeToObject3D
list.description: Traverse a THREE.Object3D and append in each Object3D children a THREE.LineSegment geometry representing its wireframe

list.title: autoDurationTravel
list.description:
Compute a distance automatically for travel features of itowns Planar View

Note: Code retrieve itowns - {@link https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/blob/1bad0d627764c73b606179c636ad7b70105dd633/src/Controls/PlanarControls.js#L712}

list.title: bindLightTransform
list.description: Place the directional light in order its shadow camera fit the object

list.title: cameraFitRectangle
list.description: Move camera transform so the rectangle define by min & max (in the xy plane) fit the entire screen

list.title: checkParentChild
list.description: Check if an html element belong to another one recursively

list.title: colorSpace
list.description: Texture encoding used to have the right color of the .glb model + have an alpha channel

list.title: computeNearFarCamera
list.description: Compute near and far of camera in order to wrap a box define by a min and max value

list.title: createDisplayable
list.description: Create a button to toggle visibility of the content in a container

list.title: createSpriteFromString
list.description: Generates a sprite with text from a given string

list.title: defaultConfigScene
list.description: Default scene 3D config

list.title: downloadImageOnDisk
list.description: Download an image on the local disk

list.title: downloadObjectAsJson
list.description: Download on the local disk an object as .json

list.title: fetchC3DTileFeatureWithNodeText
list.description: fetchC3DTileFeatureWithNodeText takes a parameter batchTableKey and returns a feature from a 3DTileslayer if the batch table content of the feature contains a given batchTableValue string in the given key. Returns an object containing the first matching feature and its layer.

list.title: file.js
list.description: Set of functions to mainpulate files

list.title: focusC3DTilesLayer
list.description: Focus a C3DTiles Layer

list.title: focusCameraOn
list.description: Makes the camera move to focus on the target position.

list.title: getUriLocalname
list.description: Return the localname of a URI

list.title: getUriNamespace
list.description: Return the namespace of a URI

list.title: initRenderer
list.description: Initialize the webgl renderer with default values

list.title: initScene
list.description: Init scene 3D with {@link SceneConfig}

list.title: loadJSON
list.description: Request a json file on a distant server

list.title: loadMultipleJSON
list.description: Load multiples .json files

list.title: loadTextFile
list.description: Request a text file on a distant server

list.title: localStorageSetMatrix4
list.description: If there was a matrix4 recorded in localStorage restore it matrix4 + when tab is closing record current matrix4 /!\ calling this function make window reference the matrix4 avoiding it to be GC and could cause memory leak

list.title: localStorageSetVector3
list.description: If there was a vector 3 recorded in localStorage within the key passed copy values in vector3 + when tab is closing record current vector3 values /!\ calling this function make window reference the vector3 avoiding it to be GC and could cause memory leak

list.title: readFileAsGltf
list.description: change callback of an input file reading gltf

list.title: readSingleFileAsDataUrl
list.description: To be used with an input of type file

list.title: readSingleFileAsText
list.description: To be used with an input of type file

list.title: tokenizeURI
list.description: Tokenize a URI into a namespace and localname A uri is typically composed of a [namespace]#[localname] e.g. http://site.io/test#example_1 here the namespace is 'http://site.io/test#' and the localname is 'example_1'
